dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Alfred W. Thomson, Lawrence M. Page (2006): Genera of the Asian Catfish Families Sisoridae and Erethistidae (Teleostei: Siluriformes). Zootaxa 1345, 1-96: 15-15, URL:http://www.zoobank.org/urn:lsid:zoobank.org:pub:25EFA792-7DA4-4E0D-A69A-12591B8422DE
dataObjects.description:
Erethistes hara (Hamilton 1822)

Pimelodus hara Hamilton 1822 ZBK : 190, 378. Type locality: Hooghly River south of Ranaghat , India . Neotype : UMMZ 244697 . Neotype designated by Ng & Kottelat (2005).

Pimelodus asperus McClelland 1844 ZBK : 404, pl. 24 (fig. 2). Type locality: Hooghly River south of Ranaghat , India . Neotype : UMMZ 244697 . Neotype designated by Ng & Kottelat (2005). Synonymized with Hara hara ZBK (= Erethistes hara ) by Ng & Kottelat (2005).

Hara saharsai Datta Munshi & Srivastava 1988 ZBK : 265, fig. 5. Type locality: Kosi Belt [Ganges drainages], n. Bihar , India . Syntypes : Bhagalpur Univ., Dept. Zool. Mus. 67 (13). Also appeared as new in Srivastava & Datta Munshi in Srivastava 1989:121, fig. 1. Synonymized with Hara hara ZBK (= Erethistes hara ) by Talwar & Jhingran (1991).

Distribution: Ganges, Brahmaputra and Irrawaddy drainages, northeast India, Bangladesh, Nepal and Myanmar (Jayaram, 1981; Lipton, 1985; Ataur Rahman, 1989; Mamnur Rashid et al., 1997). Most reports from Myanmar appear to be based on Erethistes filamentosus . We have examined specimens from the Brahmaputra drainage in Bangladesh, and the Irrawaddy drainage in northern Myanmar.

Brahmaputra drainage : FMNH 93597 (3; 44.0-47.7), UMMZ 208748 (15; 32.9-45.8), UMMZ 208994 (1; 41.6). Irrawaddy drainage : USNM 346169 (1; 48.4).

dataObjects.description:
Erethistes pusillus Mueller & Troschel 1849 ZBK

Erethistes pusillus Mueller & Troschel 1849 ZBK : 12, pl. 1 (fig. 2). Type locality: Assam [Brahmaputra drainage] . Holotype : ZMB 3102 .

Distribution: Ganges and Brahmaputra drainages Northeast India (Hora, 1950; Motwani et al., 1962; Ataur Rahman, 1989; Mamnur Rashid et al., 1997; Jayaram, 1999). Hora (1950) lists specimens from Tenasserim, southern Myanmar. Kottelat (1989) reported its distribution in the Salween drainage, Myanmar. Keishing & Vishwanath (1999) listed it as questionable from the Irrawaddy River drainage.
dataObjects.references: Alfred W. Thomson, Lawrence M. Page (2006): Genera of the Asian Catfish Families Sisoridae and Erethistidae (Teleostei: Siluriformes). Zootaxa 1345, 1-96: 17-17, URL:http://www.zoobank.org/urn:lsid:zoobank.org:pub:25EFA792-7DA4-4E0D-A69A-12591B8422DE

dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Occurs mainly in hill streams (Ref. 4833).  Found in muddy parts of rivers overgrown with vegetation (Ref. 41236).
